nodes.bodyText: I believe this is the default in 2.9.0 and probably isn't necessary here.

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            Following some examples, overriding:
          
          
            
            Overriding examples:
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,55 @@ + + + + + +GraphQL Support + + + +

GraphQL Support

+This add-on allows you to import GraphQL definitions. +

+The add-on will automatically detect any GraphQL definitions and spider them as long as they are in scope. + +

UI

+2 menu items are added to the Import menu: +
    +
  • Import a GraphQL definition from the local file system
    • +
  • Import a GraphQL definition from a URL
    • +
+ +

Target URL Format

+The Target URL has the following format:
+scheme://authority/path
+with all URI components optional. Note: while all URI components are optional, the scheme and authority become mandatory when not importing from URL.
+Following some examples, overriding:

nodes.bodyText: Should have a period as well?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+# This file defines the default (English) variants of all of the internationalised messages
+
+graphql.api.action.importFile = Imports a GraphQL schema from a local file.
+graphql.api.action.importFile.param.file = The file that contains the GraphQL schema.
+graphql.api.action.importFile.param.target = The Target URL to override the server URL present in the schema.
+graphql.api.action.importUrl = Retrieves a GraphQL schema from an endpoint URL (via Introspection)

nodes.bodyText: The cmdline entries below also seem to mix period and not period. (For my 2 cents they should have periods)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+# This file defines the default (English) variants of all of the internationalised messages
+
+graphql.api.action.importFile = Imports a GraphQL schema from a local file.
+graphql.api.action.importFile.param.file = The file that contains the GraphQL schema.
+graphql.api.action.importFile.param.target = The Target URL to override the server URL present in the schema.
+graphql.api.action.importUrl = Retrieves a GraphQL schema from an endpoint URL (via Introspection)

nodes.bodyText:
This is an awfully long menu item entry (same with the one at L14).
Can they be shortened? It's fine for the tooltip to be more verbose for clarity.
May:

Import GraphQL Schema from URL

(Still long, but much shorter)
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,19 @@
+# This file defines the default (English) variants of all of the internationalised messages
+
+graphql.api.action.importFile = Imports a GraphQL schema from a local file.
+graphql.api.action.importFile.param.file = The file that contains the GraphQL schema.
+graphql.api.action.importFile.param.target = The Target URL to override the server URL present in the schema.
+graphql.api.action.importUrl = Retrieves a GraphQL schema from an endpoint URL (via Introspection)
+graphql.api.action.importUrl.param.url = The URL locating the GraphQL endpoint.
+
+graphql.cmdline.file.help = Imports a GraphQL schema from the specified file name
+graphql.cmdline.url.help = Retrieves a GraphQL schema from the specified URL (via Introspection)
+graphql.cmdline.targeturl.help = The Target URL. Refer to the help for supported format.
+
+graphql.desc = Allows you to inspect and attack GraphQL endpoints
+graphql.topmenu.import.importgraphql = Import a GraphQL schema from the local file system
+graphql.topmenu.import.importgraphql.tooltip = The file must be a formally described GraphQL schema.
+graphql.topmenu.import.importremotegraphql = Import a GraphQL schema from an endpoint URL (via Introspection)

nodes.bodyText:
Worth adding:
and this project adheres to [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/spec/v2.0.0.html).
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+# Changelog
+All notable changes to this add-on will be documented in this file.
+
+The format is based on [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/).

nodes.bodyText: org.zaproxy.addon.graphql, being used for new add-ons.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,161 @@
+/*
+ * Zed Attack Proxy (ZAP) and its related class files.
+ *
+ * ZAP is an HTTP/HTTPS proxy for assessing web application security.
+ *
+ * Copyright 2020 The ZAP Development Team

+package org.zaproxy.zap.extension.graphql;

nodes.bodyText: I'd suggest GraphQl, having acronyms all uppercase makes it harder to read when there are several together (e.g. GraphQLAPI).
Should override canUnload and supportsDb to return true.

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,16 @@
+version = "0.0.1"
+description = "Inspect and attack GraphQL endpoints."
+
+zapAddOn {
+    addOnName.set("GraphQL Support")
+    zapVersion.set("2.9.0")
+
+    manifest {
+        author.set("ZAP Dev Team")
+    }
+
+    apiClientGen {
+        api.set("org.zaproxy.zap.extension.graphql.GraphQLAPI")
+        messages.set(file("src/main/resources/org/zaproxy/zap/extension/graphql/resources/Messages.properties"))
